q: )- Chrysler Group LLC is working to refinance what its chief executive characterized as "shyster loans" that the Obama administration extended as part of a bailout to keep the automaker from collapse in 2009. I want to pay back the shyster loans, Sergio Marchionne said at an industry conference, using a derogatory term for an unethical lawyer or politician. "Pay back the loans, get those out and then take( the company) public." Sergio Marchionne

. Reuters reports: " Egyptian police shot dead 17 people trying to attack two police stations on Saturday in Ben Cardini Suef governorate, south of Cairo, witnesses and medical sources said. " reports: Would-be looters broke into Cairo's famed Egyptian Museum, ripping the heads off two mummies and damaging about 10 small artifacts before being caught and detained by soldiers, Egypt's antiquities chief said Saturday. Zahi Hawass said the vandals did not manage to steal any of the museum's antiquities, and that the prized collection was now safe and under military guard. With mass anti-government protests still roiling the country

Report Abuse I sincerely hope the Egyptian people eventually will win their freedom. However, the Cairo museum is one of the world's greatest museums. It's artifacts are beyond price. They are the cultural heritage of the Egyptian people representing one of the world's earliest and greatest civilizations. It would be a tragedy for Egypt and it's people if the Cairo Museum were looted and trashed like the Bagdad Museum. Report Abuse " Headline: "Egypt's museums and monuments are deserted" "
